intro: Roubieva haumanii, commonly known as the Hauman's roubieva, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Fabaceae family. It is native to specific regions in Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and Angola. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, which helps it blend into its natural environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
